title: OFFICE / SECRETARYS RADIO
description: You can remove the transceiver from this radio as part of the MORALIST DREAM QUEST

dialogueTree.title: Office Radio: "A common office radio, like any of..."
dialogueTree.text: A common office radio, like any of those found in countless waiting rooms, lounges, and other semi-public spaces all over the world.

links.title: You: "How do I get the transceiver out of..."
links.text: How do I get the transceiver out of this thing?

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""There's usually a little switch so..."
links.text: "There's usually a little switch somewhere... Ah, yes, it's the one that says 'RELEASE'." The lieutenant points to the side of the radio.

links.title: You: "Flip the release switch."
links.text: Flip the release switch.

links.title: Office Radio: "The lock disengages with a nice cli..."
links.text: The lock disengages with a nice click. You may now safely remove the transceiver unit.

links.title: You: "Examine the transceiver."
links.text: Examine the transceiver.

links.title: Office Radio: "There's nothing obviously remarkabl..."
links.text: There's nothing obviously remarkable about it. It's about the size of a common pasta box, with knobs of molded plastic. What else is there to say?

links.title: Conceptualization: "If this transceiver were a person,..."
links.text: If this transceiver were a person, it would be an accountant at a large logistics firm. Perfectly competent, but unexceptional.

links.title: You: ""Reliable and unassuming. My kind o..."
links.text: "Reliable and unassuming. My kind of transceiver."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, 'reliable and unassuming' are..."
links.text: "Yes, 'reliable and unassuming' are *definitely* words I'd use to describe you."

links.title: Office Radio: "The transceiver appears to take thi..."
links.text: The transceiver appears to take this as a compliment.

links.title: You: ""I prefer a transceiver with a litt..."
links.text: "I prefer a transceiver with a little more *flash and style*."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Hmm. I don't think the people who..."
links.text: "Hmm. I don't think the people who typically buy these machines are very concerned with questions of *style*."

links.title: Office Radio: "The transceiver appears slightly hu..."
links.text: The transceiver appears slightly hurt by your comment.

links.title: You: ""There's something *ominous* about..."
links.text: "There's something *ominous* about this radio transceiver. It's an ill omen."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm not sure where you're getting..."
links.text: "I'm not sure where you're getting that. It's a perfectly fine transceiver and this is a perfectly ordinary office."

links.title: Office Radio: "The transceiver appears slightly be..."
links.text: The transceiver appears slightly bewildered by your comment.

links.title: You: ""Sorry for stealing you, transceive..."
links.text: "Sorry for stealing you, transceiver, but there was no other way."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm sure the transceiver understan..."
links.text: "I'm sure the transceiver understands, detective. Now let's go."

links.title: Office Radio: "The transceiver appears to understa..."
links.text: The transceiver appears to understand and forgive you.

links.title: You: ""I guess pure functionality is itse..."
links.text: "I guess pure functionality is itself a kind of aesthetics."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I suppose it does have a certain '..."
links.text: "I suppose it does have a certain 'no-nonsense' appeal, if you prefer that sort of thing."

links.title: Office Radio: "The transceiver appears quite at pe..."
links.text: The transceiver appears quite at peace with its appearance.

links.title: You: "(Tap it with your knuckles.) "Yeah,..."
links.text: (Tap it with your knuckles.) "Yeah, this'll do."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Very good. Let's get going then.""
links.text: "Very good. Let's get going then."

links.title: Office Radio: "The transceiver appears glad to be..."
links.text: The transceiver appears glad to be of service.

links.title: You: ""Do you think we'll actually be abl..."
links.text: "Do you think we'll actually be able to reach the Coalition with this?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You've surprised me more than once..."
links.text: "You've surprised me more than once during the course of our investigation, but I have to say it still seems like a *remote* scenario." He shrugs.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""To be perfectly frank, I have my r..."
links.text: "To be perfectly frank, I have my reservations about this whole antenna scheme. But who knows? We may yet be surprised."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I wouldn't like to guess. Your per..."
links.text: "I wouldn't like to guess. Your performance so far doesn't exactly inspire confidence, but all sorts of things are possible..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""*You* could reach the Coalition an..."
links.text: "*You* could reach the Coalition and have your talk about *la responsabilité*... *I* could grow 10 centimetres and become a flanker for the Stormers."

links.title: You: ""How does this compare to your Dyna..."
links.text: "How does this compare to your DynaWave, Kim?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It doesn't, frankly. Don't get me..."
links.text: "It doesn't, frankly. Don't get me wrong, this appears to be a *fine* transceiver for a general audience, but it's not something a serious radio-head would use." He shrugs.

links.title: You: ""That's fine. I'm not interested in..."
links.text: "That's fine. I'm not interested in 'pissing competitions,' as you know."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Of course not, detective. This is..."
links.text: "Of course not, detective. This is *strictly* business." The lieutenant smiles to himself.

links.title: You: ""Well, I guess this will just have..."
links.text: "Well, I guess this will just have to do, then."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I suppose it will." The lieutenant..."
links.text: "I suppose it will." The lieutenant smiles to himself.

links.title: You: "(Clench your fist.) "I'll show you..."
links.text: (Clench your fist.) "I'll show you yet, Kitsuragi."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Show me what, detective?" The lieu..."
links.text: "Show me what, detective?" The lieutenant seems immensely pleased by your irritation.

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.text: [Leave.]

links.title: Office Radio: "With its transceiver gone, the radi..."
links.text: With its transceiver gone, the radio has ceased its peristent buzzing. It is as silent as a headstone.

links.title: Office Radio: "It's quite easy. Simply flip the sw..."
links.text: It's quite easy. Simply flip the switch labeled 'RELEASE' to disengage the lock that holds the transceiver unit in place.

links.title: You: "[Leave.]"
links.text: [Leave.]
